pr_title: Don't run sort optimization on size=0

timeline.message:
Don't run sort optimization on size=0

Sort optimization creates TopFieldCollector that errors
when size=0. This ensures that sort optimization is not
run when size=0.

Closes #56923

timeline.bodyText: I'm wondering why we use a spy here, if we don't verify the calls after?
timeline.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: @jtibshirani Thanks for the review.  I am using spy here to wrap an instance of searchContext for it to return a fake mapperService on the following line of 711.   Since we don't have a real node here,  I had to create a fake MapperService on line 646.
replies.author: mayya-sharipova

timeline.bodyText:
What if 'size' is 0 but 'from' is not, can this case uses sort optimization?  if it can, changing this place to "from + size" may be much better.
Feel free about this, just an advice :P
timeline.author: yyff

replies.bodyText: @yyff thanks for pointing this out! It seems unusual to perform a search with from: n, size: 0, but I do agree it's more consistent to check 'num hits' (which is from + size) instead of just size. @mayya-sharipova what are your thoughts on adjusting this?
replies.author: jtibshirani

replies.bodyText: @yyff @jtibshirani Thanks for commenting.  I have addressed this in #57250
